column4: Hi... when trying to update to 12.04 from 11.10, I get the message "It was not possible to calculate the update". How should I proceed to upload?
is it network failure ?
nope :(
re-launch your update manager may help , it should be dependency problem
i mean the package list downloaded maybe in-complete ..
I tried that... next step is purging all ppas
take a look here http://markmail.org/thread/fgo5e7hl6qanvk2f , do you have any error message ?
ppas are disabled during update .. IIRC
my issue is quite similar to the one this guy had
any error message ? there might be some "icon" you can click on , that shows the details
I'll rerun to see the error again... it takes a while to get to that stage, just a min
http://i.imgur.com/G5dHa.png
the same issue the guy reported on the mail list you showed me
can you translate the line started with "E:" ?
It is impossible to correct the problems, you kept on hold broken packages.
should I just fresh install 12.04? :-/
sorry i can't help you then .. maybe you can try laterly , in a few days , or report a bug to ubuntu
burn a desktop CD is the easiest
the bug has been reported already... let's hope they fix it then :)
thank you anyway. :)
you can write a simple bash script , so next time you install new Ubuntu , just execute that script
cool idea =)
